column3: You don't need to reserve space here, so please don't do it. "Premature optimization is the root of all evil".\n

I saw this in other places in the code and just wanted to do the same ... thought it would be considered standard in the code base for large strings. I'll revert this one.

Edit: Updated!
Yeah, no problem. That other place you saw it is probably performance-critical, such as building baseX strings etc or messages that get printed all the time. \n
